answerText: Pantagruel[10] Pantagruel and his father Gargantua were created by this bawdy 16th-century French author, who used their adventures as a satire of the Catholic Church, leading politicians, and other aspects of his time.
heading: DRAGOON |2013 | 13 | 13 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: To determine whether his best friend should get married, he opens random pages of the Aeneid. For 10 points each: [10] Name this character who befriends the roguish Panurge and goes with him on a voyage to the Oracle of the Holy Bottle in the fifth book in which he appears.
